content.title: 2018年のノーベル平和賞は、戦争での性的暴力の使用についての認識を高める - フォーブス
content.desc: The Nobel Peace Prize is an award that is meant for a person “who shall have done the most or the best work for fraternity between nations, for the abolition or reduction of standing armies and for the holding and promotion of peace congresses.” Over the years, it has been awarded to many extraordinary people who have spent their lives dedicated to achieving a state of peace. Recipients have included Malala, the International Committee of the Red Cross, Mother Teresa, the European Union, Shirin Ebadi, Kofi Annan, the United Nations, Médecins Sans Frontières and many more.
